data.meta_description: SNF is a specialty chemical group whose products contribute to treating, recycling, and preserving water, and saving energy.
data.text:
SNF HELLAS is a subsidiary of the SNF Group, a pioneer in soft chemistry which comprises subsidiaries and joint ventures in over 70 countries, a longstanding presence on all continents, and 21 production sites in Europe, The Americas, Asia, and Australia.

SNF is a specialty chemical group whose products contribute to treating, recycling, and preserving water, and saving energy. Innovation and movement towards a cleaner, less carbon-intensive world are great accelerators of SNF’s growth, which has exceeded a €4.9 billion turnover in 2022.

International Support and Local Expertise

SNF HELLAS follows the growth and development of new technologies with a portfolio of more than 1,000 products aimed at creating mutually beneficial relationships with customers and partners. Experienced personnel and certifications according to ISO 9001:2015, 14001:2015, and 45001:2015 ensure high-quality services in respect to stringent EU regulations and directives.

Our products and services are used in:

Drinking Water Treatment

Wastewater Treatment

Sludge Management

Mining and Quarries

Oil & Gas

Pulp & Paper

Detergents and Paints

Agriculture

Personal Care

Textiles

Construction & Civil Engineering

Dredging

Desalination

SNF HELLAS expressly adapts to individual customer needs with presales and aftersales technical support, including job site visits by SNF HELLAS engineers in combination with field technicians where necessary. Project finetuning is addressed with state-of-the-art laboratory equipment for trials and product selection.

Being a member of the world’s preeminent provider of sustainable water chemistry, SNF HELLAS is committed to being the market’s most reliable source of water-soluble polymers and services and contribute to a safe and healthy environment by helping our customers to treat waste, supply pure drinking water, and reduce environmental impact by improving their industrial processes.

Regional Certifications

ISO, the International Organization for Standardization, is an independent, non-governmental organization, the members of which are the standards organizations of the 164 member countries. It is the world’s largest developer of voluntary international standards and facilitates world trade by providing common standards between nations. Nearly twenty thousand standards have been set covering everything from manufactured products and technology to food safety, agriculture, and healthcare. Use of the standards aids in the creation of products and services that are safe, reliable, and of good quality. The standards help businesses increase productivity while minimizing errors and waste. By enabling products from different markets to be directly compared, they facilitate companies in entering new markets and assist in the development of global trade on a fair basis. The standards also serve to safeguard consumers and the end-users of products and services, ensuring that certified products conform to the minimum standards set internationally. SNF has been certified to meet the standards of ISO.
